subject: Creativity
title: The Drum Machine: How a Box Replaced a Band
description: One-minute skill: The Drum Machine: How a Box Replaced a Band.

hook.text: The Roland TR-808 was a commercial flop in 1980. Today it defines hip-hop, pop, and electronic music worldwide.

buildup.text: Before drum machines, recording required live drummers, expensive studios, and perfect timing across multiple takes.

discovery.text: Afrika Bambaataa used the cheap, unwanted 808 to create 'Planet Rock' in 1982, launching electronic hip-hop.

twist.text: The 808's kick drum was 'wrong' â€” too deep, too boomy. That flaw became the most recognizable sound in modern music.

climax.text: Kanye West named an album '808s & Heartbreak.' The machine that nobody wanted reshaped an entire art form.

punchline.text: A failed product became music's most creative tool.

quiz.question: Which drum machine flopped commercially but later defined modern music?
